text: It's a quick walk to the top (around 30 minutes). Train station is just around the corner.  I stopped by one of the French-Asian cafe for sugar and an iced americano. Because they don't have anything up the little mountain. So, bring water with you.You would be able to see the Hangang river, bridges, and the Seoul skyline from the top. It's a colorful landscape at night. At one point, I had to set my tripod beside three other tripods because this place is frequented by photographers. Stop by an hour before sunset to see it transition from light to dark.
